title: GICHD, Geneva International Center for Humanitarian Demining, 2019-2024
description: Geneva International Centre for Humanitarian Demining (GICHD) is an international expert organisation working to reduce the impacts of mines, cluster munition, and other explosive hazards in close partnership with national authorities, mine action organisations and other human security actors. The GICHD aims to enhance expertise, methods and good practice of mine action, as well as develop innovative tools and technologies for clearance. Their work with Information Management helps national authorities and mine action organisations with the collection, analysis and timely provision of information to support clearance operations. On behalf of the United Nations, the GICHD also develops, maintains and promotes the International Mine Action Standards (IMAS). Furthermore, they work on promoting instruments of international law, norms and standards, and evidence-based policies. Advisory services and trainings on all aspects of mine action; institutional, strategic, managerial and operational, are provided, primarily for national authorities.
